author: jimmygchen
content: Sorry I'm a bit late to  this conversation. Peer sampling is an optional feature in the spec, and I was hoping we *could* implement it to reduce bandwidth usage. It could be used to enable higher blob counts in future BPO forks before Glamsterdam.  Is this no longer what we want?

author: jimmygchen
content: Nope, this make sense and likely don't require changes for most clients i believe? at least for Lighthouse

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Please note if you see 

```
Evaluation error: Cannot construct 'ServiceConfig' from the provided arguments.
        Caused by: ServiceConfig: unexpected keyword argument "tty_enabled"
```

You need to update your kurtosis engine to version 1.9+.

Run `kurtosis version` to fetch your current version.

If your current kurtosis is version is reported to be `2.1.0` then you are on a borked kurtosis release. Please reinstall kurtosis, and it should get you back on track.

content: Fusaka-devnet-2 genesis at <t:1750932000:R>

author: barnabasbusa
content:
It would be really good to have all CL devs take a look at their cgc/eth2/nfd values BEFORE fulu, and make 100% sure that you got all the fields correct. I have set FULU 1d from now, so every client will have sufficient time to take a look and push out final fixes. 
1/2 of nodes are supernodes
1/2 of nodes are full nodes
Every node has 8 validators
Every node's cgc should be 0x08 BEFORE fulu.
Everyone's eth2 value should match everyone else's eth2 value
Everyone's nfd value should match everyone else's nfd value

author: barnabasbusa
content: I have included every client combo in the fusaka-devnet-2. Having fulu a day from now should give enough time to everyone to be able to make a fulu ready fusaka-devnet-2 branch.

content: cgc should 0x08 for fullnode, 0x80 for supernode, right?

author: barnabasbusa
content: Tooling is online: https://fusaka-devnet-2.ethpandaops.io

author: barnabasbusa
content: We need all these values fixed ideally in the next few hours. Please if you see your name tagged, get on this.

author: barnabasbusa
content:
I'm planning to roll out watchtower on fusaka-devnet-2. This will enable us to automatically deploy new fusaka images. Watchtower will check every 2 mins if there is a new fusaka image avaialble (using the same tag) and yolo roll it out. Please be aware of this, as we are also automatically build fusaka-devnet-2 branches now, so if you push something yolo into that branch it might take all clients of your pair offline. 
Thanks for coming to my ted talk.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Just to confirm, devnet-2 launched with 7907 active? I see that the 11k+ accounts with "big code" have not been deployed, so I guess we have to do this manually to bench test the new code size reads (and which will also flag clients which do not have a quick codeSize lookup). I'm converting the perfnet benches to EEST and spamoor so we can deploy these benches in the future also üôÇ

author: __flcl
content: Similar thing for hive tests might be useful, with an exception of the main branch as it may trigger too often

author: jochembrouwer
content: Do all clients have a codeHash => codeSize cache in some form implemented? (either in memory or as extra db)

author: jochembrouwer
content: This is unfortunate, because the disk lookup attack will need 11k+ contracts. For it to be the most effective we have to deploy the max size contracts (so limited by the 30M gas limit per tx). This however means we can only deploy 1 contract per block. So we need 11k+ blocks to setup the disk attack üò¶

author: jochembrouwer
content: I actually want to do this "attack" because it will most likely throw out all clients which do not have the codeHash => codeSize cache

author: barnabasbusa
content: it‚Äôs active as of tomorrow epoch 256

author: barnabasbusa
content: 30M gas limit will only be live from tomorrow, so today you can still do 45M txs
